trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_000<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>? I-I thought you had returned to the Source! Heavens forbid something went awry with the spell!?
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_001<tab>...All is well, then? I am relieved to hear that.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_010<tab>Oh, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. What brings you back to the First? Another adventure, mayhap?
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_020<tab>If you've come to speak with Y'shtola, she has already left to assist Urianger.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_021<tab>Have no fear, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, we will see to it the white auracite is made ready in due course.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_030<tab>Ah, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Found your hands idle in the Source, did you? Sadly, I have nothing I can ask of you here either. But know that we are doing all we can to see the Scions returned home safely.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_Q1_000_500<tab>What would you like to do?
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_A1_000_501<tab>Ask about recent developments.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_A1_000_502<tab>Show him your wind-up G'raha.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_A1_000_503<tab>Call him G'raha Tia.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_A1_000_504<tab>Nothing.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_510<tab>As to be expected, the recent changes in Norvrandt were invariably accompanied by some disarray. But the people have embraced the night with joy in their hearts, and they go about rebuilding their lives with optimism.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_511<tab>Your fellow Scions have each returned whence it all began for them, to lend a helping hand during this period of transition.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_512<tab>Alphinaud is in Eulmore, Alisaie at the Inn at Journey's Head, and Y'shtola with the Night's Blessed.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_513<tab>Thancred and Ryne, meanwhile, continue their investigation in the Empty.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_514<tab>Thancred and Ryne continue to be guests of the Crystarium, though of late they are often afield on some matter or other.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_515<tab>I had instructions to summon everyone hither should you return, but busy as they all appear to be, perhaps the reunion can wait a little while.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_516<tab>Rest assured I continue searching for a way to deliver your comrades home. So please, take your ease and enjoy some time to yourself.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_550<tab>The people of Norvrandt have embraced the night with tremendous enthusiasm. One might even say it is the coming of a new age.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_551<tab>Eulmore is well on its way to reformation, and Beq Lugg tells me the treatment of patients at the Inn at Journey's Head is coming along quite nicely.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_552<tab>Such strides in so short a time would have been impossible if not for you and the others.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_553<tab>All the more reason I would give them─as Beq Lugg might say─their own fitting payment. We <var 1A 02 /var>will<var 1A 01 /var> get them home, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. I swear it.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_520<tab>Wh-What in the world is this?
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_521<tab>A gift from Tataru, you say? A mammet inspired by a certain Archon, created to fund the expedition to the Syrcus Trench...

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_522<tab>Passing strange... I never had the pleasure of meeting Tataru. That being the case, I can only assume the idea for the subject matter came from another.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_523<tab>Could it have been Master Galuf? Or Krile, perhaps? No, wait─Rammbroes! It must be Rammbroes!

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_524<tab>Behind his somber countenance there hides a playful streak. I can fair see him grinning as he imagines how I would react should I stumble into this mammet sometime in the future...

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_525<tab>If truth be told, I know not how to feel when I behold it. But if nothing else, it tells me that they are well. Rammbroes and everyone. And for that I am glad.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_526<tab>...I see. If truth be told, I know not how to feel when I behold it.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_527<tab>Please, put it away. It is...more than I can take right now.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_530<tab>...!

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_531<tab>How strangely that name rings to the ears... Long as I have been the Crystal Exarch, it has ceased to be an act. This is very much who I am now.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_532<tab>Yet when you speak to me as the young man I once was, he cannot help but stir within.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_533<tab>And then the old days come flooding back. The days when we sought the truth of this tower together...
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_MYSTERYVOICE_000_534<tab>You were an inspiration to me then. Though I did not think it possible, you have become even more of an inspiration to me now.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_600<tab>I suppose we ought to take stock of the situation. By forestalling the Eighth Umbral Calamity, we have unwritten history. The future now lies beyond my ken.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_601<tab>None can say what awaits, but so long as we stand together, I doubt not but that we can overcome all trials. We have always done so, have we not?
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_Q1_000_650<tab>What would you like to do?
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_A1_000_651<tab>Ask how he fares of late.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_A1_000_652<tab>Show him your wind-up Mystel.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_A1_000_653<tab>Nothing.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_700<tab>Do you mean since I reawakened in this body? The hunger being par for the course, I have no complaints. All appears to be well.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_701<tab>Though my memories straddle the lives I have lived, there are no contradicting fragments which cause me confusion.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_702<tab>Yet by the same token, 'tis a strange feeling to be possessed of my young body again. Even accounting for the crystallization, I do not recall ever being so light and spry.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_703<tab>As for my soul, Y'shtola assures me it is similar to yours, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. That is to say it is somewhat denser than others, but otherwise normal.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_704<tab>On the face of it, it appears to make sense, but I couldn't help but consider the differences between your circumstance and mine.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_705<tab>You, of course, merged with Ardbert. And as similar as your souls may have been, the fact is you were different people. Thus did your soul gain in density.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_706<tab><var 1A 02 /var>How<var 1A 01 /var> you were able to merge is another matter. Given what we know of the soul, that you possessed distinct memories should have rendered the process more complicated. Though I but theorize, perhaps your strong and shared desire to do so made it possible.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_707<tab>In contrast, I simply merged with myself. Whatever additional experiences the older me may have had, my fundamental existence remained unchanged. Mind you, that's not to say that I hadn't improved! Far from it!

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_708<tab>At any rate, when our souls combined, it shouldn't have been a process of augmentation, but rather...shall we say, attunement. It seems somewhat strange that my soul has become denser.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_709<tab>Or could this be the result of having undergone another Rejoining? If so, it would serve as proof of a future that many fought and died to prevent. Lest we forget, my friend. Lest we forget...
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_710<tab>Well, now... I have my suspicions as to what this is about, but would you be so good as to confirm them for me?
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_711<tab>Aye, just as I thought. They went ahead with it after all.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_712<tab>The artisans of the Mean had come to me with a proposal, you see. In celebration of the night's return, they asked how I wished to be commemorated: on a coin, or as an automaton.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_713<tab>Neither, I replied...for all the good it did. They <var 1A 02 /var>knew<var 1A 01 /var> I would be embarrassed─it makes no difference what name they give it. Yet still they did it...

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_714<tab>A right stubborn lot, they are...as befits the people of the Crystarium. They shall be just fine without me, and Lyna may rest assured I do not worry for them.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_715<tab>Nevertheless, I shall never cease to pray for their happiness.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_716<tab>No longer am I a leader of a nation. Whatever power and influence I may have wielded, I left behind as surely as I left my body.

TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_717<tab>But everything I have ever felt and experienced... All of these things and more I have brought with me─<var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> have brought for me.
TEXT_REGNOR4CRYSTALEXARCH_00611_GRAHATIA_000_718<tab>And I shall carry them close to my heart always, unto the end of my days.
